abstract: Masked vandals invade offices of advocacy group Committee Against Torture in Grozny, Chechnya, causing employees to flee through windows; organization says pleas for help were ignored by local authorities, suggesting violence was officially sanctioned by government; computers and records of group, which publicizes human rights abuses in Chechnya and throughout Russia, are destroyed.
lead_paragraph: Employees of the Committee Against Torture said the local authorities in Grozny, the Russian region’s capital, had ignored calls pleading for help.

headline.main: In Chechnya, Human Rights Group’s Offices Are Vandalized
headline.print_headline: Vandals in Chechnya Ruin Offices of Rights Group

snippet: Employees of the Committee Against Torture said the local authorities in Grozny, the Russian region’s capital, had ignored calls pleading for help.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
